text.section: Before an organization may conduct bingo under this subtitle, the organization shall obtain a permit from the county commissioners.

section.section: A qualified organization may conduct bingo in the county to benefit charity or to further the purpose of the qualified organization.
A senior center site council may obtain a permit to conduct bingo in a senior center 5 days per week, excluding Sunday.

A senior center site council may not:
award a prize of money to a winner exceeding $50 in each session; or
charge more than 5 cents for each bingo card.
All money that remains after prizes are awarded shall be distributed to the senior center site council.
An applicant for a permit shall pay the fee that the county commissioners set.
The county commissioners shall set the permit fee at a level sufficient to cover the costs of issuing the permit.
Only the holder of a permit issued under this section may conduct bingo authorized by the permit.
The holder of a permit issued under this section may not transfer or assign the right to conduct bingo to another person.
